title: TUNE2 Function Block
description: The TUNE2 function block is designed to control a variable output (Y) based on user-defined inputs including set, reset, and speed adjustment commands. It implements a state machine to handle slow and fast up/down operations while ensuring the output remains within specified limits. The block also allows for timing-based ramp adjustments based on input parameters.
name: TUNE2

input.name: SET
input.description: Indicator to set the output to SET_val.

input.name: SU
input.description: Signal to initiate a slow step up operation.

input.name: SD
input.description: Signal to initiate a slow step down operation.

input.name: FU
input.description: Signal to initiate a fast step up operation.

input.name: FD
input.description: Signal to initiate a fast step down operation.

input.name: RST
input.description: Indicator to reset the output to RST_val.

input.name: SS
input.description: The amount to be added or subtracted during each slow step operation.

input.name: FS
input.description: The amount to be added or subtracted during each fast step operation.

input.name: Limit_L
input.description: The lower limit for the output.

input.name: LIMIT_H
input.description: The upper limit for the output.

input.name: RST_val
input.description: The value to assign to Y when the reset is triggered.

input.name: SET_val
input.description: The value to assign to Y when the set operation is triggered.

input.name: TR
input.description: The time duration for the ramp operation.

input.name: S1
input.description: The speed factor used for slow movements.

input.name: S2
input.description: The speed factor used for fast movements.

output.name: Y
output.description: The output value after processing commands.
